title: Plain Markdown
content:
Plain Markdown # This page contains examples of plain Markdown. It should include any non-shortcode markup that we want the migration to support.
Inline text formatting # You can italicize text, or bold it.
Text can also be formatted as a plain link, bold link, or italic link.
Lists # Ordered # Here’s an ordered list of steps:
Figure out how to migrate to Astro. Make some incredible docs. Profit. Unordered # Here’s an unordered version of the same list, which doesn’t make as much sense, but that’s okay.
Figure out how to migrate to Astro. Make some incredible docs. Profit. Code # console.log("Hello, world!"); Table # Column 1 Column 2 Column 3 Row 1, Col 1 Row 1, Col 2 Row 1, Col 3 Row 2, Col 1 Row 2, Col 2 Row 2, Col 3 Row 3, Col 1 Row 3, Col 2 Row 3, Col 3 Row 4, Col 1 Row 4, Col 2 Row 4, Col 3

title: A Simple Shortcode
content:
A Simple Shortcode # This page demos a simple shortcode that takes a few attributes and renders a square based on those attributes.
All of the squares below represent the same shortcode configured differently.
Default square # Pink square with thicker border # Rounded pink square with thicker border # Centered rounded pink square with thicker border #
